Course Offered to: CSE102 Data Structures and Algorithms, CSE202 Fundamentals of Database Systems
Course Description: This course introduces fundamental ideas underlying geospatial science, systems and services. These include spatial concepts and data models, spatial query languages, spatial storage and indexing, query processing and optimization, spatial networks, spatial data mining. Some future research trends in spatial computing would also be covered.

Course Outcomes.CO1: Understanding of spatial data, and how it is represented, and analyzed.
Course Outcomes.CO2: Ability to solve basic spatial analysis problems.
Course Outcomes.CO3: Some understanding of the current challenges and trends in spatial computing
Course Outcomes.CO4: Understanding of research problems and approaches in spatial computing

Weekly Lecture Plan.Assignments: Text book problems on fundamental spatial concepts, Programming assignment based on Google’s geo-location API
Programming assignment based on Flickr/ Twitter geo-location API

Resource Material.Textbook: GIS A Computing Perspective; CRC Press; 2nd edition, 2004.
